website_summaries.verdict: The Glidecam HD-2000 can best be described as the poor man's Steadicam. It produces results worthy of a Hollywood production, but requires practice and skill for the best results.
pros: Allows you to capture smooth handheld shots

customer_reviews.title: Awesome video camera stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: This stabilizer works exactly as advertised. It's very well priced for what it does. I bought this as an alternative to the Seadicam camera stabilizer and I couldn't be happier. I needed this for a video project and it does take a while to dial in but once it's set, it has no lingering pitch and straighten perfectly. The build is great and I can tell that it's machined under high quality. The base can be a little long and the counterweight spread at the base could be a little annoying, but I noticed that you can rotate it 90 degrees and then it's not a problem at all. Highly recommended. It's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: A.H.

customer_reviews.title: Quite worth the price? Ehh...
customer_reviews.text: Takes a ton of time to balance just right, but when you do it's pretty darn good for it's size. Definitely one of the best steady-cam type products I have used personally, but without a full body rig, how steady can you get. I recommend it over others, just know what you're getting into when you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and well worth the price difference from the XR.
customer_reviews.text: I traded the XR in for this one and it was worth every penny. You can get this one perfectly balanced in a few minutes. The XR takes forever... or you just give up (in my experience). So definitely get this one unless you plan on sticking to the same camera/lens combo at all times. My only complaint is that it can be a bit hard to adjust the rod length over and over again–the knob could be a bit wider so you have more leverage. But who cares, the thing works great.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Get yer glide on
customer_reviews.text: Please don't let all the difficult setup hype deter you away from this unit. I too, like most people who buy these was really intimidated but honestly it only took me about 15 minutes to attain near perfect balance. Its really not that hard, you just have to understand the product and how it functions. I did a video tutorial on how to balance a 7D in 15 minutes on this little guy so if anyone is interested just search YouTube for "How To Balance A Glidecam HD-2000 & Canon 7D In 15 Minutes Or Less". It may be helpful in your decision to purchase or to help you balance you camera.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, makes real smooth video scenes.
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the unit balanced correctly, it produced some very smooth video scenes for me. The trick is to not use so many weights if using a smaller camera. I am using a Sony NEX-7, which is relatively lightweight. The only thing I might recommend to the vendor is making attaching weights to the top plate a little easier. I had to source nut/bolt/washer myself, but once I had added a single weight to the top, the drop time slowed down considerably and it held its position nicely. Now all I have to do is find a gear bag for it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stockton

customer_reviews.title: great addition to DSLR video enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: Well, not too hard to balance, even with heavier lenses, Canon 17-40F4.0 and 5D-MarkIII, I have 4 weights only and thinking of rebalancing it to 2 weights total (out of I think 12 it came with). Very smooth recording, a little heavy setup, not a Glidecam. Very well build, I considered to build myself, but save long trail of frustration and just buy this well engineered device. Not sure why would any DSLR owner need 4000 model, extra weight and size... 2000 does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Kojoukhinator Sr.

customer_reviews.title: its so worth the price omg i love it. just one thing
customer_reviews.text: its so worth the price omg i love it. just one thing, it is a pain in the butt when it comes to balancing, once i get it set perfect, I won't be so annoyed. Seriously, I thought it would be easy at the start but its crazy!! Cant balance it for the life of me but thats my own issue because Im quite new to this!! Great packaging and all in all a great product. I would highly recommend this to people who shoot weddings or short films/movies. The shots I take make me feel like the camera was flying in the air, AMAZING!! I LOVE MY GLIDECAM!! Works well for the CANON 600D
customer_reviews.author: Aman Lalka

customer_reviews.title: Love This Glidecam!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several different home-made gliders for DSLR video with mixed results. After getting this one and going through the process of balancing it, I was glad to see the results I had been wanting. It does take some getting used to and there is a bit of a learning curve. It takes a little while of using it to really get used to it and practicing with it before you can really take off. I love the solid build and the smoothness of this and would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to get into DSLR video.
customer_reviews.author: dexterity357

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Action for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting used to but you'll figure it out. Just practice and use during gigs. Held it for 12 hours straight last weekend. With my Canon 6d and 24-105mm lens...my right arm is bigger lol.
customer_reviews.author: Hapa Logie

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: I love my Glidecam HD-2000. It makes videos look so smooth! After a bit of fenagling, this thing can really do some magic once it is balanced. I would recommend it to any aspiring film makers, as it makes any video footage look so much more professional. Amazing
customer_reviews.author: AEguy

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item! I would recommend getting the manfrotto quick release plate combo though. But great device! Totally makes a difference when your using a cheap steadicam and then you use this. Totally worth the money, don't second guess yourself on this item! Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Anny Haro

customer_reviews.title: Good Stabilizer, poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: The Glidecam itself is good once you get it put together and balanced, however the instructions that come with it for balancing are very poor. Going online to seek out balancing videos is your best bet, but even then it might take some time to get it perfect. Overall I have been happy with it so far. I can run around and get very smooth shots.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B.

customer_reviews.title: Glidecam HD2000 review
customer_reviews.text: This is my first purchase of any kind of product to help with stabilization while recording video. This product is absolutely amazing. I was researching the difference between this and other products but was not able find out if there was a significant difference. I watched a few videos on youtube for proper setup, and once I got it set up and most importantly, learned the best angle for holding the handle (at 3 o'clock), its been absolutely amazing. I really like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Steady Cam
customer_reviews.text: As is the case with all steady cams, there is a learning curve to using this product. It definitely gets heavy during longer takes, but if you have small breaks you will be good to go for a while. I love how simple it is to fine tune the balancing. That alone is worth the extra couple hundred dollars right there. Nothing is worst then spending more time trying to balance a steady cam then actually filming with one. All in all I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Funk

customer_reviews.title: I AM IN LOVE
customer_reviews.text: A year ago I purchased this item. Today I get the greatest footages for my projects in film school. So smooth. Hard thing is balancing, ESPECIALLY when you have new gear like lenses and mics on your camera -.- ALWAYS have to change it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cepeda

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!!! Great control and the grip of the item is comfortable. Took some time to get used to it, but worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Khris Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great camera stabilizer. Works as it should. Takes a little getting used to (as with any new product). Telescoping post was difficult to adjust up and down and was scratching against the adjustment knob clamp, but was easily fixed by contacting Glidecam Industries.
customer_reviews.author: Jason James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: After watching a couple of easily found videos on youtube about balancing the weights I found this rather easy to use. The quality that it gives your video is incredible. I highly recommend this for anyone that has a dslr and is looking for a less inexpensive route than a Steadycam.
customer_reviews.author: SPACECOWB0Y

customer_reviews.title: As advertized
customer_reviews.text: This thing takes a while to dial in with the weights and is quite a bit heavier then expected but does the job. Once you get it balanced and practice it is hard to beat the steadiness you can achieve.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Matz

customer_reviews.title: Great steady flow for DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Great steady flow for DSLR. It can be combined with a steadycam vest for improved performance and longer shooting times.
customer_reviews.author: William Wolffe

customer_reviews.title: Wise purchase
customer_reviews.text: Once you figure out how to balance, it works well. Has improved our video shoots dramatically! Highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Hunnicutt

customer_reviews.title: Art of Flying
customer_reviews.text: Remarkable piece of equipment! If you don't own one and you're an aspiring filmmaker like myself, you best get one as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: mistersnappyp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the T3i!
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble choosing which HD Glidecam I was going to get. I looked up a lot of YouTube videos and finally made a decision to get the HD-2000. I have friends with both the 1000 and 4000 and the 2000 worked better than both of them for my T3i with kit lens and a microphone attachment. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Mainor

customer_reviews.title: Great Steadycam for DSLR Video
customer_reviews.text: Thus far, the Glidecam HD-2000 has really blown me away with how easy it was to assemble and balance. I'm shooting with a canon 7D as well as some pretty heavy lenses, and its holding up quite well, even with only 2 weights on the bottom. Compared to most steadycam rigs on which you would have to loosen the entire quick release just to balance, The glidecam cam has fine tuning dials that make it so much quicker. I had near perfect balance on this setup in around just around 10 minutes out of the box. As far as i'm concerned, it's worth every penny just because of how much time it saves you on set.
customer_reviews.author: Videoguy93

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Only have to balance it once before a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only have to balance it once before a event then it is set to go. Very sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.author: P.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great price. great quality. Dont import it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of kit. Easy to use and set up but takes some practice. Came in perfect condition and very quickly. Was a fantastic price at the time of buy including shipping. The only bad thing is customs fees DO NOT BUY THIS FROM AMERICA if you live overseas you can help it. Customs stung me over £100 which made the item £60 dearer than if id bought it from the main uk seller. Not the sellers fault though and would definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. I returned it because I found it cheaper on BHPhoto
customer_reviews.author: Sang P Lee

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for the Gorilla Filmmaker
customer_reviews.text: This glidecam is excellent for the gorilla filmmaker and any dslr shooter. It may seem pricey but it is worth every penny. You won't regret this purchase. I had no problem balancing the glidecam. I suggest looking up a tutorial on youtube for a more in depth tutorial if needed. This is definitly a must have for the rebel one man filmmaker.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, perfect and makes your videos look professional once you get used to holding it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Love

customer_reviews.title: Glidecam hd200
customer_reviews.text: This is the best handheld stabilizer out there. I've tried others like the steadicam. Nothing compares to the glidecam hd2000, but make sure you are in fact getting the hd2000 and not some other model. I usually run it with my 7d with 14mm lens or panasonic hmc150. Here's a youtube video I shot with it: [...]
customer_reviews.author: stevenforeman

customer_reviews.title: Use it for everything
customer_reviews.text: I had a 2000 pro and a friend of mine had just bought the HD-2000. Tried it out and sold my 2000 pro the next day. Stability is phenomenal. There are those who will tell you that there are cheaper brands that are just as good, but I'd beg to differ. I have tried "DIY/homemade" to cheap ebay brands and nothing comes close to this. Def. worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good product !!
customer_reviews.text: I like it, easy to use, transportable, and does what it tell you to do, the only thing, is you just need to have some strength on your arms to hold it for larger time. but nice product!!
customer_reviews.author: Juninho Zam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: The Glidecam has exceeded my expectations! With the right balancing it makes your shots so freaking amazing. And you can pick it up very easily. If you want to start getting professional looking shots then the glidecam products are the way to go
customer_reviews.author: PaynePill

customer_reviews.title: Best stabilizer on the market
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic stabilizer. The ability to adjust the weights makes fine tuning the balance incredibly easy.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Highland

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty worth it...
customer_reviews.text: A truly excellent device, for stabilizing video, especially when you're running and gunning as well as easy to use...
customer_reviews.author: Meztrov

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: need it! one of the greatest tools for camerawork, worth every penny, can't be happier owning this.. i definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Glidecam is a good product
customer_reviews.text: After balancing my dslr on this product my fears of shooting video were greatly reduced. Not a cheap product but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger H.

customer_reviews.title: Practice...
customer_reviews.text: This product works great, but beware that it does involve a lot of practice and time to set up the rig to balance it properly. You can watch videos on youtube.com for other instructions. I bought it for my Canon 60D and it works great. I also recommend getting the manfrotto removable base plate as well, it will save you time in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Canon 5D Mark II
customer_reviews.text: Thought is was going to be harder to balance. Thank goodness for youtube. Practice with it a lot and you'll be very happy. I can't stand my old footage now ; )
customer_reviews.author: C. Moriarity

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! There is a learning curve for sure, and I'm still getting the hang of it, but it works very nicely. My shots are stable no matter what I am doing when I film.
customer_reviews.author: _jazt10

customer_reviews.title: my baby
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how i filmed without this before...i love it so much. I take it on just about everything. I am about to buy a vest and dual-arm because it gets quite heavy and annoying with some heavier lenses but again...it is worth EVERY PENNY
customer_reviews.author: Yazz

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: It takes some adjustment and practice, but it works just as described. It's also a good workout, but be sure to swap hands around or else one of your arms will look like Popeye's.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Dotson

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Great product; a little pricy, but worth it. Made of steel so it can't break and it makes shots flawlessly smooth. Would recommend to any videographer
customer_reviews.author: Austin Collins

customer_reviews.title: It's what ever
customer_reviews.text: It works well, the problem is that the instructions are no helpful, so plan on using third party sources to teach you how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: TBRA

customer_reviews.title: great results
customer_reviews.text: Balancing it requires much practice, and many you tube video tutorials, but once balanced properly --> resulting video looks amazing. Even jumping over obstacles, the video produced looks smooth as silk. Would definitely recommend the glidecam to any videographers.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: kinda hard to figure out how to really make it work. But i think it takes some practice...
customer_reviews.author: Arthur A.

customer_reviews.title: Glidecam hd 2000
customer_reviews.text: This product takes some experience before getting good at it, still working at it but balancing the Glidecam is an ever ending task. I do recommend but to be honest, sometimes the most expensive things aren't the best things.
customer_reviews.author: Lostinthewoods

customer_reviews.title: It worked after a while setting it up. It's ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked after a while setting it up. It's quite difficult (almost impossible) to use for shots where you need to hold the camera lower than your shoulders, which most of our shots are.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey V. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: WAAAAY TOOOO HEAVY!!
customer_reviews.text: Only buy this if you're going to use it with a vest that can transfer the weight off of your arm. It's way to heavy to operate for even short periods of time otherwise. I'm 5' 10", average build, average strength, etc. I used this HD-2000 with my Canon 5D mark ii and a 24-105 lens and could only hold it for a few seconds before my arm and wrist started to ache. I tried smaller lenses to no avail. It's simply way to heavy to use without some kind of additional support.
customer_reviews.author: V. CrofootTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about this product other than the fact that ...
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this product other than the fact that its missing 98% of all the bolts it has to come with and my project im shooting is tomorrow morning. Great just great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Sigh, I watched Devin Supertramp's videos (using this thing) for about 12 straight hours then I couldn't sleep until I bought this. Then I couldn't sleep because I realized I just spent a LOT of money for something I can hardly ever use. Just use stabilizer options in Adobe (and probably FCP) and you will get a result that is almost as good if not better and you will still have $500.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but theres better out there.
customer_reviews.text: Wouldnt reccomend this, im going to sell it and the smooth shooter and the x-10 and buy a steadicam merlin or better setup. For amature use it would be great but not for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Ephraims Photography

product_meta.title: Glidecam HD-2000 Handheld Stabilizer for Cameras from 2 to 6 lbs
feature_bullets: Designed for compact cameras weighing from 2 to 6 lbs (0.9-2.7 kg)
Fine adjustable dynamic camera mounting platform
Adjustable dynamic balance and inertial-control base platform
Comes with manual, counter weight plates and mounting hardware

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars129 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
